section.name: Data repositories
section.p: To avoid duplication of genome, annotation and genome index files, Eoulsan handles data repositories. It is very useful for genome indexes used in the mapping step witch computation is quite long for large genomes. The genome index repository store the result an index computation for the next analysis using this genome.

File extension (e.g. .fasta, .gff) and file compression extensions must be avoided in the genome and annotation URL. Eoulsan automatically add the file extension and check if a compressed file exists in the repository.

subsection.name: Genome index repository
subsection.p: Unlike previous repositories, the genome index repository have no dedicated protocol. The only user of this repository is the genome index creation step. When a genome index must be computed, this step check if a genome index has been already computed for this genome and mapper. If true, the previous computed genome is used, if false, the genome index is computed and then stored for a next usage.
To use genome index repository, user must only define the following global parameter (In configuration file or in the globals section of the workflow file) :

subsection.p: Note: The path to the genome indexes cannot be an URL. The path must be writtable for the user to allow Eoulsan storing genome indexes.

subsection.name: Genome description repository
subsection.p: The genome description file contains some basic informations about the genome like the chromosome lengths. This file is useful for creation of valid SAM/BAM files and using the genome index repository. This file is created from the genome file at each new analysis. However creating this file is quite long for large genome (like mouse or human genome) when compressed. The genome description repository allow to avoid useless genome sequence parsing once it has been already parsed in a previous analysis.
To use genome description repository, user must only define the following global parameter (In configuration file or in the globals section of the workflow file) :
